title: My active backlog is of 9 credits. If the backlog of 16 credits comes in 3rd sem, will the year back be imposed?

comments.body: Absolutely not. You will still be pushed forward to the next sem, no worries there.
Bro if your cumulative backlog credits is more than 22, vertical mobility comes into picture and you need to skip an year to pass
I think this is an old rule that's not valid anymore. I'm not sure though.
If your backlog are 24 credits then there will be year back for u. From August 2023 onwards the rule was implemented before that there was no rule like this
Bro did u not even fucking glance at the slides for like a year or somethin?? I did the bare min and I'm only having a decent gpa.. like damn man what the hell

nah mate, get your life back on track, at this pace you might get a yearback. Don't listen if people say gpa doesn't matter, it matters a lot if you wanna sit or placements or wanna do your further studies.
Oh? That's news to me. Did this come from a reliable source?

It's not that simple dude. Not every department has the same difficulty when it comes to exams. More than 45% ppl failed at least one subject in my department in third sem. Just going through slides isn't gonna cut it in many subjects like acd in ece for example
What's your department?? I'm in cs fam
It isn't simple. But failing or passing a subject doesn't depend on difficulty. The student is too lazy or not interested in the subject at all.
